Isaac may prompt GOP convention cancellation

There is a distinct possibility that the 2012 Republican National Convention will be canceled because of potential storm damage away from the convention's host city of Tampa, Florida. (Boston Globe)

Eagle Scouts return badges to protest Boy Scouts' anti-gay member policy

Dozens of past Scouts are returning their awards to the Boy Scouts of America in protest of the organization’s longtime code that bars openly gay members. (Globe)
  • As Scouts return medals, gay ban still firm  |  Discuss

Drivers, not cellphones, are high-risk

People who chat behind the wheel often drive more aggressively even after they hang up, says a new Massachusetts Institute of Technology study. (Globe)

Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Will the Red Sox stick
with Bobby Valentine?

If Valentine is their manager for next year, the Red Sox need to come out and say it. End all the speculation.

New effort set to curtail sewage

A settlement reached in federal court promises an accelerated attack on pollution from the labyrinth of pipes under Boston and from pavement runoff.
Opinion | JOHN E. SUNUNU

Paul Ryan gives left wing the jitters

For Democratic operatives, demonizing Paul Ryan was supposed to be easy. But a funny thing happened on the way to this week’s convention.

Springfield narrowing its casino field

Critics say Springfield’s plan to whittle as many as four casino proposals down to one could hurt the city’s chances to win the Western Mass. casino license.

For $83, a sling and no easy answers

James Dichter’s discovery that he was fitted with a sling that cost his insurer $83, even though it’s $7 online, reveals the intricacies of medical purchasing.

Creating bright ways to light the way

Inside a 19th-century cotton mill on the banks of the Merrimack River, Performance Indicator LLC is making paints that gleam brightly all night long.

Hispaniola death toll from Isaac climbs to 10 people

Haitians began to dig themselves out of the mud on Sunday, one day after Tropical Storm Isaac doused the nation and killed eight people there and another two in the Dominican Republic.

Politics

AP-GfK poll: Raise taxes to save Social Security

A new Associated Press-GfK poll found most Americans say to raise taxes if it will save Social Security benefits for future generations. And raise the retirement age, if you have to.
